required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on February 08, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Assess the Efficacy and Safety of Risankizumab in Participants With Ulcerative Colitis
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo Controlled 52-Week Maintenance and an Open-Label Extension Study of the Efficacy and Safety of Risankizumab in Subjects With Ulcerative Colitis

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to evaluate safety and efficacy of risankizumab in participants with ulcerative colitis (UC) in participants who responded to induction treatment with risankizumab in a prior AbbVie study of risankizumab in UC.
This study consists of three sub-studies: Substudy 1 is a 52-week, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled maintenance study; Substudy 2 is 52-week, randomized, exploratory maintenance study; and Substudy 3 is an open-label long-term extension study for participants who completed Substudy 1 or 2, or participants who responded to induction treatment in Study M16-067 with no final endoscopy due to the Covid-19 pandemic.

primary_outcome.measure: Sub-Study 1: Percentage of Participants with Clinical Remission per Adapted Mayo Score
primary_outcome.description: Clinical remission per Adapted Mayo Score.

primary_outcome.measure: Sub-Study 3: Percentage of Participants with Adverse Events (AE)
primary_outcome.description: An Adverse Event (AE) is defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a participant or clinical investigation participant administered a pharmaceutical product and which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sub-Study 1: Percentage of Participants with Endoscopic Improvement
secondary_outcome.description: Endoscopic improvement per endoscopy subscore.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sub-Study 1: Percentage of Participants with Clinical Remission per Full Mayo Score in Participants with a Full Mayo Score of 6 to 12 at Baseline (of Induction)
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical remission per full Mayo Score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sub-Study 1: Percentage of Participants who Discontinued Corticosteroid Use, in Participants Taking Steroids at Baseline (of induction).
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants who discontinued corticosteroid use, in participants taking steroids at baseline (of induction).

secondary_outcome.measure: Sub-Study 1: Percentage of Participants with Clinical Remission per Adapted Mayo Score in Participants with a Clinical Remission at Week 0
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical remission per Adapted Mayo Score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sub-Study 1: Percentage of Participants who Discontinued Corticosteroid Use, Remained Corticosteroid Free for 90 days and Achieved Clinical Remission in Participants who were Taking Steroids at Baseline (of induction)
secondary_outcome.description: Participants who discontinued corticosteroid use.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sub-Study 1: Percentage of Participants with Clinical Response per Adapted Mayo Score
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical response per Adapted Mayo Score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sub-Study 1: Percentage of Participants Achieving Histologic-Endoscopic Mucosal Improvement
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants achieving histologic-endoscopic mucosal improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sub-Study 1: Percentage of Participants with Endoscopic Remission
secondary_outcome.description: Endoscopic remission per endoscopy subscore.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sub-Study 1: Percentage of Participants with Endoscopic Improvement in Participants with Endoscopic Improvement at Week 0
secondary_outcome.description: Endoscopic improvement per endoscopy subscore.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sub-Study 1: Percentage of Participants with Ulcerative Colitis (UC) Related Hospitalization
secondary_outcome.description: Participants with a UC event that results in admission to the hospital.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sub-Study 1: Percentage of Participants with Histologic Remission
secondary_outcome.description: Histologic remission per Geboes Score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sub-Study 1: Percentage of Participants who Reported No Abdominal Pain
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants who reported no abdominal pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sub-Study 1: Percentage of Participants who Reported No Bowel Urgency
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants who reported no bowel urgency.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sub-Study 1: Percentage of Participants with Mucosal Healing
secondary_outcome.description: Mucosal healing defined as endoscopic and histologic remission.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sub-Study 1: Change in Inflammatory Bowel Disease Questionnaire (IBDQ)
secondary_outcome.description: The IBDQ is used to assess the quality of life of patients with inflammatory bowel disease.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sub-Study 1: Percentage of Participants with Ulcerative Colitis (UC)-Related Surgeries
secondary_outcome.description: Participants who underwent surgery related to UC.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sub-Study 1: Change in Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy-Fatigue (FACIT-Fatigue)
secondary_outcome.description: The FACIT-Fatigue is a validated tool that measures an individual's level of fatigue during their usual daily activities over the past week.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sub-Study 1: Percentage of Participants who Reported No Nocturnal Bowel Movements
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants who reported no nocturnal bowel movements.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sub-Study 1: Percentage of Participants who Reported No Tenesmus
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants who reported no tenesmus.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sub-Study 1: Change in Number of Fecal Incontinence Episodes per Week
secondary_outcome.description: Change in number of fecal incontinence episodes per week.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sub-Study 1: Change in Number of Days per Week with Sleep Interrupted due to UC Symptoms
secondary_outcome.description: Change in number of days per week with sleep interrupted due to UC symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sub-Study 1: Change in 36-Item Short Form Health Status Survey (SF-36)
secondary_outcome.description: The SF-36 is an indicator of overall health status.

arm_group.description: Participants randomized to receive placebo for risankizumab administered by subcutaneous (SC) injection.
Participants randomized to receive risankizumab dose 1 administered by subcutaneous (SC) injection.
Participants randomized to receive risankizumab dose 2 administered by subcutaneous (SC) injection.
Participants randomized to receive risankizumab dose 1 administered by subcutaneous (SC) injection.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Substudy 2: OL Therapeutic Drug Monitoring Risankizumab
arm_group.description: Participants randomized to receive risankizumab dose 1 administered by subcutaneous (SC) injection.
Participants who completed Sub-study 1 or 2 receive open-label risankizumab in Sub-study 3.

intervention.arm_group_label: Substudy 2: OL Therapeutic Drug Monitoring Risankizumab

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants who have completed Study M16-067 and have achieved clinical response as defined in the protocol.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participants who have a known hypersensitivity to risankizumab or the excipients of any of the study drugs or the ingredients of chinese hamster ovary (CHO) or had an adverse event (AE) during Studies M16-067 that in the Investigator's judgment makes the participant unsuitable for this study.
- Participant is considered by the Investigator, for any reason, to be an unsuitable candidate for the study.
- Participant is not in compliance with prior and concomitant medication requirements throughout Studies M16-067.

link.description: This clinical study may be evaluating a usage that is not currently FDA approved. Please see US Prescribing Information for approved uses.

patient_data.ipd_description: AbbVie is committed to responsible data sharing regarding the clinical trials we sponsor. This includes access to anonymized, individual and trial-level data (analysis data sets), as well as other information (e.g., protocols and clinical study reports), as long as the trials are not part of an ongoing or planned regulatory submission. This includes requests for clinical trial data for unlicensed products and indications.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data requests can be submitted at any time and the data will be accessible for 12 months, with possible extensions considered.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Access to this clinical trial data can be requested by any qualified researchers who engage in rigorous, independent scientific research, and will be provided following review and approval of a research proposal and Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP) and execution of a Data Sharing Agreement (DSA). For more information on the process, or to submit a request, visit the following link.
